End-to-end Encryption

No 3rd-party involvement in encrypting/decrypting.

The cryptographic keys are in the hands of sender and receiver to encrypt and decrypt.

  • Typical server-based communications systems do not include end-to-end encryption. These systems can only guarantee protection of communications between clients and servers, not between the communicating parties themselves.
  • The company itself holds the cryptographic key data that lets it decrypt your messagesâ€”and so, therefore, does any hacker who compromises the company or government official standing over its shoulder.
